page.title: 11ST. MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: In 1985 Catholics in{Grangetown celebrated two important events in their history.On February 19th they marked the centenary of the opening of St.Mary's Church with a concelebrated Mass led by{Augustine Harris,Bishop of {Middlesbrough.}The pupils of St.Mary's Junior School led the singing while 36 priest assisted the Bishop in front of a congregation of 500 people which included the{Mayor of Langbaurgh}and other V.I.Ps.This was not the original building which was a small chapel on an adjacent site.Extract from {N.E.Gazette on opening of present {building.The building cost {considerably over Â£5000 and is of {Gothic style of architecture {...provision is made for three altars {and 570 people can be accomodated.An {up to date heating apparatus lighted {by gas has been installed.
